titleStmt.title: Description of British Library, Add MS 27036: Kabbalistic homilies by Natan ben Reuven Shapira.

notesStmt.note: Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Kabbalistic homilies by Natan ben Reuven Shapira.

msItem.title: Kabbalistic homilies by Natan ben Reuven Shapira.

layoutDesc.layout: Columns: 1 ; ruled lines: 27 28; written lines: 27 28; Uniform layout. Titles in larger characters. Catchwords on every verso. Visible vertical hard-point ruling. Coloured edges.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian cursive script of the 17th to 18th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Derushim. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,036.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 142: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for Â£1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153): inscribed, folio [89v] (fse002v).
